newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: MIM shares sprint higher, top turnover.
newsitem.headline: MIM shares sprint higher, top turnover.

text.p: Shares in major mining group MIM Holdings Ltd jumped nearly five percent higher to A$1.73 on Friday and topped turnover lists with 5.7 million shares traded as investors bought in after Thursday's announced restructuring of its Queensland coal interests.
MIM said it expected to book an abnormal profit of A$40 million on the restructuring of its interest in the Newlands-Collinsville-Abbot Point (NCA) project.
"They look pretty good and Thursday's announcement has generated a lot of interest," said a dealer at a Sydney-based brokerage.

Under the plan, MIM said it would exercise its option to retain a 75 percent stake in the project. This decision followed last year's agreement with Itochu Corp for the Japanese company to acquire the other 25 percent stake from Agipcoal Australia Pty Ltd and the project debt from the banks.
By 12.30 p.m. (0230 GMT), MIM shares were eight cents higher at A$1.73 on turnover of 5.8 million shares.
